# multipleSelectionBackgroundView

**Instance Property**

The background view to use for a selected cell when the table view allows multiple row selections.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var multipleSelectionBackgroundView: UIView? { get set }
```

## Discussion

If this property isn’t `nil`, this view becomes the background view for a selected cell when the table view allows multiple row selections. You enable multiple row selections through the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/allowsMultipleSelection] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/allowsMultipleSelectionDuringEditing] properties of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView].

A background configuration is mutually exclusive with background views, so you must use one approach or the other. Setting a non-`nil` value for this property resets [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableViewCell/backgroundConfiguration-24e8e] to `nil`.

## Configuring the background

- **defaultBackgroundConfiguration()**: Retrieves a background configuration with system default values.
- **backgroundConfiguration**: The current background configuration of the cell.
- **automaticallyUpdatesBackgroundConfiguration**: A Boolean value that determines whether the cell automatically updates its background configuration when its state changes.
- **backgroundView**: The view to use as the background of the cell.
- **selectedBackgroundView**: The view to use as the background for a selected cell.
